question_text: What is a major limitation of the USB mini B connector compared to modern USB-C?
answer_options: It only supports fiber optic signals
It provides higher voltage but lower current
It lacks orientation flexibility and has limited data rates
It does not support audio playback on mobile devices
correct_answer: It lacks orientation flexibility and has limited data rates
explanation: USB mini B must be inserted in one orientation and supports lower speeds than modern USB-C, which is reversible and supports higher power and data rates.
